snippet.title: The times were a-changing
snippet.content: IN 1967, when the Sunshine Coast was officially named, the Vietnam War was in full swing, The Beatles were topping the charts with their Sgt Pepper album and the world was changing forever - both musically and culturally. The changes were reflected on the Sunshine Coast as much as anywhere. Live music was still king, with local bands such as The Mercy Beats and The Gemini Four rocking local venues. Surfing music was booming and the younger crowds liked nothing better than doing The Stomp at their local hall. It would be a few more years before places such as Surfair, Thommo's Pub and the Reef Hotel began packing the punters in to hear some of the biggest names in the country. Cold Chisel, INXS, Midnight Oil and The Angels all played here during the heady days of the late 1970s and 1980s, when people like Bill Glasson and Ashley Robinson were running the venues and booking the talent. A young Barry Charles arrived in Noosa and soon made his mark, playing some memorable gigs and eventually establishing the Full Moon Dances at the Verrierdale Hall. Drive-in theatres were all the rage but if you wanted take-away for dinner, the food was good but the selection limited to fish and chips, burgers or maybe some Chinese - until the likes of Annette Sym came along and taught us how to eat healthy again. Bar, restaurant to pave way for precinct renewal Family face life in limbo Lexis English secures new riverside offices in CBD TODAY we have a much more adventurous palate Maleny open day throws spotlight on theatre groups The popular comedian brings her latest show to the Sunshine Coast The Voice winner Judah Kelly announces national tour. WE were the first building to open in Sunshine Plaza. GREAT venues and great people. MEMORIES of Surfair, Thommo's and Stewart's. CLASSIC Aussie film Romper Stomper will be revived with a TV sequel. WARNING: Nudity. Australian Survivor turns X-rated tonight. Charles said it was his right to have a mistress The house featured on TV series Grand Designs Australia in 2014 What your money will get you in the Beef Cap v the capital city: Prime block lays dormant for decade in Coast town Rental vacancies disappear as Coast heads for boom
